etomica.graphics

Class DisplayTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.graphics.Display
      • etomica.graphics.DisplayTable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataSetListener, DataTableListener, GraphicalElement

    public class DisplayTable
extends Display
implements DataTableListener
    Presents data in a tabular form.

        public java.awt.Component graphic(java.lang.Object obj)
        Description copied from class: Display
        Method of Simulation.GraphicElement interface. Default action is to return this Display (which is a Panel) as the graphic object. May override in subclass to return a more appropriate graphical element, or none at all.
        Specified by:
        graphic in interface GraphicalElement
        Overrides:
        graphic in class Display
        Parameters:
        obj - An object that might be used to specify the graphic that the GraphicalElement is to return. In most cases the GraphicalElement ignores this parameter, and it can be set to null.
        Returns:
        A Component that can be used in the GUI of a graphical simulation
        See Also:
        Device, Display

      • tableModel

        public javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel tableModel()

      • getRowLabels

        public java.lang.String[] getRowLabels()
        Descriptive text for each row.

      • setRowLabels

        public void setRowLabels(java.lang.String[] newRowLabels)
        Sets values for descriptive text for each row (as defined before transpose). Display of labels is determined by value of showingRowLabels (if not transposing) or showingColumnHeaders (if transposing). Setting the row labels will persist. To cause the row labels to be taken from the IDataInfo again after calling setRowLabels, setRowLabels must be called again with null argument.

      • setUnit

        public void setUnit(DataTag[] dataTags,
                    Unit newUnit)

      • recomputeUnits

        protected void recomputeUnits()
        Reconstruct the units array. Manually-set units for columns are stored in a HashMap (keyed to the column), so this method looks for units in the HashMap and if that fails, uses the column's dimension's default unit. Old units (from old columns) are not removed from the hash, because the DataSinkTables doesn't know with certainty that it no longer contains a column. If the column magically comes back, we need to use any previously-set unit.

      • recomputeColumnHeaders

        protected void recomputeColumnHeaders()
        Reconstruct the column headers array. Manually-set headers for columns are used if they were set and if not, uses the column's own header is used.

      • setAllUnits

        public void setAllUnits(Unit newUnit)
        Sets the units of all columns to the given unit.

      • getUnit

        public Unit getUnit(int i)
        Returns the unit assign to the i-th column (as defined before any transpose).
        Parameters:
        i - column index, numbered from zero, not including the row-label column
        Returns:
        the unit of the indicated column

      • isShowingColumnHeaders

      • isShowingUnits

        public boolean isShowingUnits()
        Returns:
        Returns the showingUnits flag, which indicates whether a units suffix is applied to the column headers (or row labels, if transposing).

      • setShowingUnits

        public void setShowingUnits(boolean showingUnits)
        Flag indicating whether a units suffix applied to the column headers (or row labels, if transposing). Default is true.
        Parameters:
        showingUnits - The showingUnits flag to set.

      • getRowLabelColumnHeader

        public java.lang.String getRowLabelColumnHeader()
        Returns the header of the row-label column. Not used if showingRowLabels is false. Default is empty string.

      • setRowLabelColumnHeader

        public void setRowLabelColumnHeader(java.lang.String rowLabelColumnHeader)
        Sets the header of the row-label column. Not used if showingRowLabels is false.
